intro: Harpalyce formosa var. formosa, commonly known as the showy harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, hairy seeds enclosed in a pod. This species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role in its native habitat.
